title: Arctic Wolf Aurora Endpoint Security Memory Protection and Script Control Insights
description: This dashboard provides a comprehensive summary of aurora protect memory protection, and script control events.

definition.content:
[Arctic Wolf Aurora Endpoint Security](https://docs.arcticwolf.com/bundle/AES-Overview/page/What-is-Aurora-Endpoint-Security.html) is a unified solution that helpsÂ  to tackle modern threats. It provides comprehensive capabilities to detect and protect against threats across endpoints.

This dashboard provides a comprehensive summary of aurora protect memory protection, and script control events.

For more information, see the [Arctic Wolf Aurora Endpoint Security Integration Documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/arctic_wolf_aurora_platform/).

**Tips**
- Use the timeframe selector in the upper-right corner of the dashboard to change the default timeframe.
- Clone this dashboard to rearrange, modify, and add widgets and visualizations.

Shows exploit-related activity detected on devices, including allowed, blocked, or terminated attempts involving suspicious memory behavior. Includes details such as violation type, process name, policy, user, and device information, helping identify possible code injection, remote thread creation, payload execution, or other memory-based attacks that may indicate exploitation attempts.

Tracks script activity on devices, including alerts, blocked scripts, and allowed executions. Provides details such as file path, interpreter type and version, policy applied, file hash, and device zones to help monitor and control script-based actions across endpoints.
